website_summaries.verdict: A top-notch survival machete that offers a supreme blend of affordability and strength.
pros: Equipped with a high-carbon and riveted steel blade to ensure optimal performance
Includes a rubber handle that makes it simple to control the machete
Sold with a nylon case that enables you to securely carry the machete
cons: Steel blade tends to be soft and weak and may start to bend after moderate use

customer_reviews.title: Mistake
customer_reviews.text: I had an original for yrs..still use it. Got this one a few yrs ago and was nervous to use it because of the bad reviews. I thought it might let me down when I needed it. Well, after yrs of sitting in its sheath I grabbed it by mistake instead of the old one...here are the results of 1 use.
customer_reviews.author: unsatisfied

customer_reviews.title: Terrible - weak steel!
customer_reviews.text: My husband used this machete for 30 minutes on typical small branches (less than an inch in diameter) and the blade was severely bent. The steel is very weak! It looks great but he was stunned by how soft the metal was. He really thought that the "Gerber" name would provide a better product. We sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Mangled after first use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this exact machete last summer and used the crap out of it, still do. But I bought a second last month so two of us can make a trail through the woods. My husband used the newer one and hacked at a branch that was maybe 2” in diameter and it completely tore apart the blade, a string of metal was hanging there. I don’t know if we just got a faulty one or what, but it’s pretty disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: Only good for light duty work, not wood or small shrubs
customer_reviews.text: Do not waste your money. This is my second Gator Machete and the first one lasted me several years except for a tear out while slashing 1/2" saplings of soft wood. It was acceptable due to it's age and I ground down the tear (near the tip) and am still using it today. I figured having a new one would be good, but quickly realized the quality is even lower than the first generation I originally purchased. Within 5 minutes of use I have 2 fold overs on the upper half of the blade that render it useless without grinding and resharpening. I guess this machete is only good for greens and light slashing. I do not recommend this tool.
customer_reviews.author: James R.

customer_reviews.title: Buy a Corona Machete Instead
customer_reviews.text: Look this Gerber Gator machete is neat looking and all, but it is cheaply made. A few whacks and the blade was rolling bad. I think this is supposed to be a "hey look at how tactical I am machete," and not an actual usable one. Especially not for everyday use. I bought a cheaper Corona machete years ago, and have never had blade rolling or chipping, it just kept chewing through piece after piece of wood. Long story short, if you want to look "cool" with this Gator Machete strapped to your G.H.B. of B.O.B go ahead. I'll be deep in the woods with a garden machete doing more work and enjoying it, while you play "operator."
customer_reviews.author: Joshua P

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 different brands of machetes and honestly everyone that sees these asks where I get this from. I bought 3x of these because I went on a trip to Vanuatu with a large group of people to help build a couple buildings in the jungle to help the locals out. They cut really well and I gave them away to the local chiefs and they loved them. Everyone that used my machetes loves them and would fight over them to use them. I highly recommend people to buy these because they won’t be disappointed with the quality and the craftsmanship of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Lpguy

customer_reviews.title: Good for cheap trail clearing
customer_reviews.text: I did get roll over on the blade after trimming off some branches on a fallen tree. The grip is made out of rubber so it can cause blisters if striking wood over and over. That's expected for a cheap machete but I use it for trail clearing when I'm on my atv. If it gets stolen while being left on my atv I wouldn't cry about it and that's why I bought this one. I would recommend sharpening it once you receive it for better cutting and use it more for brush than cutting 2-3" branches on a tree.
customer_reviews.author: Jenai Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Best Prop Ever
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice looking product, but it didn't last long at all. If you're intention is to cut through soft weeds and vines, go for it, but don't expect much if you run into anything sturdier than shrubs and bushes. Stay well away from anything with bark. It may cut into it, but you won't get through, and the blade will bend. I keep it around to serve as a reminder to never cheap out on tools. I followed up with the Fiskars Axe Headed machete, and wow! It's scary efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Dandy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing blade durability
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for Christmas, tried it out on the Christmas tree. It cut through small branches and did well on chopping. After inspecting it the blade now has a bend/twist in it and has 1 notch in the blade and several small dents, from small Christmas tree branches. I'm disappointed the blade is bent after a few minutes of use and it is already nicked. I worry that if I ever needed to use this for more than 5 minutes it would dull/dent/chip so fast that it would be a single use item.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: A very handy tool and both blades work well for occasional use.
customer_reviews.text: I used this machete to chop down some bamboo trees in my back yard, and the saw blade worked very well. I sharpened the machete blade with a file before using it to trim my palm trees and the blade worked very well. I don't think that I would use this tool on a regular basis, but it's fine for my occasional trimming needs. I also have this thing for additional protection against any of Florida's "creepy crawlies" that may lurk in the bushes. I couldn't go wrong for the price that I paid, and it comes with a sheath that has a belt loop. I'm very pleased with this tool
customer_reviews.author: J. R.

customer_reviews.title: One fine machete
customer_reviews.text: The reviews showing chips and bends in the blade are bonkers, totally misguiding people, likely competitor products or someone that used the machete for something it was not made for. This was easy to sharpen to a fine edge and has held it after many uses in the woods. I am not chopping trees down...axes are for that. I am cutting small limbs, palm frons and weeds with it. Very well balanced and a great handle!
customer_reviews.author: Neurotico

customer_reviews.title: meh.. ok first small vines and brush. not heavier branches
customer_reviews.text: very thin profile blade. it worked great the first time i used it. the second time i was cutting thicker branches and hit a hard center and it rolled the edge in 2 spots. i tried to straighten it but obviously that wasnt going to work. i love the handle on it. it also feels like theres some play in the handle. my return window closed on it unfortunately because really how often do you use a machete. bottom line sharp great for very thin whacking dont use it on anything bigger than your thumb.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: This machete is AWESOME!!! I LOVE GERBER PRODUCTS!!!
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I got word that we were about to be quarantined, I immediately searched for a machete to start clearing brush and small trees on my 3-acre property and WOW!!! I've cut down at least 300 small trees, one inch in diameter! I've been cutting away sticker bushes and fallen tree branches for the last 3 weeks!!! You have to cut at an angle and not straight across. It just seems to work better that way. Great product!!!
customer_reviews.author: r-borrows

customer_reviews.title: Chinese Crap Steel, NOT Gerber quility! STAY AWAY!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a land surveyor and have been using Gerber machetes for a while now. This machete is an embarrassment for the Gerber name. I used the machete within a week of purchase and with less than 12 ,well placed, swings the edge folded over. I was not cutting an iron pipe, just a good ol' pepper tree branch, roughly 2" in diameter. I flattened the blade and re-sharpened, same results as the first round, the blade just folded over and asked to be thrown into the ditch I was working on. I obliged and chucked it with all my might, that was the most satisfaction this particular Gerber gave me. Never again!
customer_reviews.author: Lugnut

customer_reviews.title: Good Machete for Suburban Use.
customer_reviews.text: Good for Recreational Use.To clean up small weeds or Branches/Brush.I wouldn’t chop anything over 1/2 inch with full Power.Im not saying it isn’t durable,But know what you’re buying.Dont Expect a Rhino when Paying for a Mule. This is a Good,Handy,Soccer Mom Machete,Not a Clear a Path in the Amazon Machete.Again,Realize what you’re buying.
customer_reviews.author: TimeLord

customer_reviews.title: Missing Product.
customer_reviews.text: I really can't rate the whole product as it arrived missing the most important part, the Machete. Someone at the Amazon Wearhouse has a free machete. Because that thing just didn't fall out or was not added to the order. It was removed. However, the Nylon Sheath looked really nice and durable. So I gave half a review. Amazon is taking this back free of charge and sending me a new one, free of charge. Let's see how that goes. Stay tuned....
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: weak cutting edge
customer_reviews.text: first time hacking on 2" dia. pine branch the cutting edge got bigger divits in it than the pibe wood. like i was attempting to cut a iron pipe. total failure of metal hardness. Never scene anything like it. Laugh-able but for the waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: whitney

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: If you don't own one if these you should stop reading reviews and just buy it. This is my second one and I love it! Blade is quality material and holds it's edge very well (unless you accidentally smash it into a steel rod, haha). Even with a slight dent in my blade it works very well. I bought a second one as a backup. Also, the saw blade on the back side of the blade works great and holds sharpness as well. Great product Gerber!!
customer_reviews.author: Coop

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money, dont buy.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a month and a half back. First time is used was today. Hacked a small sappling. Literally bent the blade over. So disappointed. I thought Gerber was a good brand. If I can find out how to add pictures I will.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Low quality steel thin blade
customer_reviews.text: I buy Gerber for good steel quality. This product is junk. It’s a thin blade, low quality steel (you can’t even sharpen it it’s too soft). Made in China. Don’t buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Optimus Prime

customer_reviews.title: pretty good
customer_reviews.text: the handle is a little too thick and the lanyard isnt big enuf to go around my hand. makes a pleasant 'shing' sound when cutting weeds. saw portion doesnt saw very well but it works well for pulling branches to you after cutting them.
customer_reviews.author: Debra L.

customer_reviews.title: Cheep, won't last long.
customer_reviews.text: Since the day I got this the sheath started falling apart, the handle is lose, and worst of all the blade started breaking and bending. Fist it chipped a little bit from a rock, a couple days later on a normal tree it bent so bad some of the blade actually like bent almost off. Not impressed. Don't get me wrong it's a good machete but won't last over a month or two
customer_reviews.author: J. Rowe

customer_reviews.title: metal too thin
customer_reviews.text: The feel of this tool is great but the performance does not suit my needs. This one is designed for surgical precision but can't handle the big stuff. The blade is ground to such a keen edge that it splits and curls when it encounters anything harder than a twig. now I only use it for cutting the small stuff
customer_reviews.author: JoeC

customer_reviews.title: the blade bent on first use!
customer_reviews.text: this machete looks like it would be great, but it's anything but. the blade is VERY thin and flimsy. The blade bent during the first day of use. I was cutting limbs and branches not thicker than 6". Sure, Gerber has a warranty. But to pay to ship this knife back to receive another crap knife is not worth it. I'd really like them to replace it with something more substantial.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn

customer_reviews.title: Piece of garbage - failed upon first use.
customer_reviews.text: Only getting one star because Amazon won't allow zero starts. I bought this product to help clear brush in my yard. Used one day, clearing new growth/shoots, nothing more than an inch in diameter, most much less. The blade dented and deformed - it looked like I had been striking iron bars not new growth wood shoots. The tool is basically worthless at this point. Don't waste your money - this is a piece of junk...
customer_reviews.author: Echo Summers

customer_reviews.title: For the price it's quite nice.
customer_reviews.text: Just got this today, spend about 205 minutes getting some branches cleared from my fence. I'm happy so far, it's pretty sharp, but not perfect. A bit heavier than I was expecting, but that's fine. Went thru brush and maybe 1/2 to 3/4 inch branches quite well. The saw side is good it did what I wanted to try with it. Going camping early next year and I plan to bring this and have some fun with it. Just need to remember my hockey mask this time.
customer_reviews.author: Hudsey

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely would never recommend this to anyone
customer_reviews.text: The machete looks solid but the blade is very cheap. The blade was severely bent after less than 20 minutes of moderate use. I should have stopped as soon as I noticed but I wanted to clear a few more branches. A piece of the blade broke where it was bent. Luckily the piece of metal did not get in my eye. I have never been as harsh with a review as I am now. I absolutely would never recommend this to anyone. I am extremely disappointed with Gerber for releasing such a poorly made product.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Ez

customer_reviews.title: Worked on an Agave
customer_reviews.text: I used this to cut back a blue agave that was starting to grow onto the sidewalk. It cut though it like butter, especially once I got a few leaves away so I could swing it harder. It is very comfortable to hold, and was less expensive than similar products at the local home improvement store with orange signage. For those I couldn't get a proper cut line, the saw did a good job of tearing through them (and out) without me getting stuck on the sharp needles. The sheath is very nice too. A lot do not come with one, and separate they can be $10-20.
customer_reviews.author: STEPHEN C MCINTOSH

customer_reviews.title: But kinda glad I bought it now
customer_reviews.text: Yeah... Bought this as a joke to to show my GF parents that you literally can buy anything off Amazon. But kinda glad I bought it now. Recently bought a lot of land and this blade made an easy path for walking. Very sharp and durable. It's my first machete and I thinks it's awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Great for backyard jobs
customer_reviews.text: I have only been using for a week but think it is a pretty solid machete for backyard jobs. Cutting vines, small tree limbs and clearing a little brush. I feel like the saw feature is pretty much decorative and doesn't work too well, the sheath is very nice but the loop to attached to a belt is a little small. I would go for something a little stronger if you are hunting or do heavy duty work but it is awesome for a little cleaning up the backyard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rather Good, with one Negative
customer_reviews.text: So far, I really like this product. In SW Florida you can be overrun with underbrush, especially on unoccupied lots. This is really good at cutting items that a chainsaw is too large for, and loppers would be too slow. One downside: I 'really' needed the included sheath with belt loop holder, well, the top of the loop just tore right out after 5 minutes. Unsure how to proceed with carrying now.... Just a little frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: WarmFLBear

customer_reviews.title: Got tore up after first day of use
customer_reviews.text: I have plenty of Gerber products that's lasted me for years, but this machete didn't last a day in the Louisiana thickect. I was using it to cut vines and small tallow trees about a inch thick. I'm going to take it to my grinder and try to knock some of the Knicks out. Was hoping this machete would last longer then the cheaper brands. That's why I chose Gerber. The gator handle does provide a comfortable grip.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: China product, AVOID
customer_reviews.text: Made in China, forget it. This is not the quality sold at military PX.
customer_reviews.author: Mark simmons

customer_reviews.title: GOOD FOR LOOKS AT THE MOST
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the package the handle was loose... Warning label clearly states to not use if handle is loose... So basically they sold me a machete that they say I can't use... wow. Well, I tightened the handle myself, but I still wouldn't use it for anything except home defence. (From the pictures it's apparent this thing chips easily). DON'T BUY IF YOU PLAN ON USING IT! :)
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good tool for the money
customer_reviews.text: I have the smaller Gator and have done lots of clearing with it. However, I wanted a longer one because with the short one I sometimes missed my mark....short. True it was not razor sharp when I received it, but four passes with my carbide sharpener took care of all that. It holds an edge as well or better than any other such tool I have owned. As for breakage...not so far....have downed a couple 6 inch trees and it held up......so far. The saw edge is nothing compared to my Corona tree trimmer. But I did not buy it for the saw edge....luckily. Still a good tool for the money
customer_reviews.author: rnldlbl

customer_reviews.title: It works for me.  It is too big for a hiking machete.
customer_reviews.text: It works for me but it is too big for hiking. Remember that the machete action is different from a hatchet. It is sort of a flipping action and at an angle through the vine seems to work best. I have gone through 2 inch thick kudzu vines in two swings and it works really well for the briars. I am careful not to hit rocks so I don't have any dings as if yet. I have not had any trouble with the scabbard.
customer_reviews.author: HerMan

customer_reviews.title: Only OK, but acceptable for the price
customer_reviews.text: Looks cheap, feels cheap. But I can't complain too much for the price. Comes with lifetime warranty. Not sure what that covers though. Great that a sheath comes with it. Sheath also has a loop for the belt to wear it around your waist. Blade was not very sharp when arrived. Although it worked when I lopped off some half inch branches. I sharpened it on a whetstone till very sharp and tested it on thicker branches, about an inch, and it easily cut it off. I will recommend this if you are tight on a budget for a machete but if you have a larger budget - skip this.
customer_reviews.author: Eric L

customer_reviews.title: IF YOU WANT HEAVY DUTY YOU MIGHT WANT TO LOOK ELSEWHERE
customer_reviews.text: From reading the reviews it seems obvious that Gerber has some QA/QC issues with its Chinese manufacturing supply chain dating back several years. I ordered this machete anyway as the price was good (when I ordered it) and the recent reviews are hit and miss. The blade was sharp enough right out of the package. I cut thru many saplings up to 2" diameter with ease. After use I cleaned and oiled the blade...then hit it a few licks with a sharpener and followed up with passes over a ceramic rod. The blade is SUPER SHARP now. The blade metal is relatively soft steel and is not rigid. This machete will serve my needs just fine.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: This is a beast! Can't wait to unleash it on the brush in our ranch
customer_reviews.text: Thing is huge and weilds like a sword! Weighted very nicely and ergonomically. We'll use it to clear brush and cactus on our ranch. Guess you could use in the house for home defense too. This is crazy scary looking in person.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Okerholm

customer_reviews.title: Somehow got a lemon
customer_reviews.text: I have had great success with Gerber and their blades. However I must have gotten the lemon and the steel was considerably too soft and when hacking very soft wood the blade quickly bent and cracked. Still this is a good machete for light work like blackberries and simple backyard tasks however if you're going to take this camping or on a hiking trail I might consider a heavier-duty machete.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Price

customer_reviews.title: This machete is great, I used it to trim two very large ...
customer_reviews.text: This machete is great, I used it to trim two very large trees in my yard to test it. I used to use a small hatchet but will never again! This thing saws great and cuts through branches larger than it should with ease. After about 6 hours of hard use over several weeks there are two spots on the blade that are bent out of shape, it still works but I would not be surprised if these spots broke soon. BUT for $20 it is better than you could expect
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: I can do a better job with my "garden sheers"
customer_reviews.text: I have tall skinny "bullrushes" on my lakefront property and it takes a lot of effort to use this machete basically all it does is "knock down" the bullrush it does not slice them or cut them...I can do a better job with my "garden sheers". I am very disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: T. D. Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if it will do its job or not!
customer_reviews.text: The size is ok. It is really hard to write a review in the middle of winter about it due to the fact that I have not gotten to use it yet. Come spring I will know a lot more about it. I don’t know if it will do its job or not.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Denton

customer_reviews.title: Hell yes
customer_reviews.text: I don't think I'll be using ONLY this machete to trim my live oak trees BUT it did make the first time more fun. Plus, I felt like a Rambo-bad-ass up there hacking away. Then turning it over and going to exhaustion from cutting 2" branches with the serrated edge.
customer_reviews.author: Donny Daughenbaugh

customer_reviews.title: I have several Gerber knives and love them. However
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying I am a fan of Gerber. I have several Gerber knives and love them. However, this machete is far below the Gerber standard in terms of blade strength. The blade is incredibly dinged and bent after only one use. Looking at the blade, you could swear I had been trying to chop through cement. The brush I was clearing consisted of chicken trees not more than 2 inches in diameter and I was not striking square on the tree, but at an angle. The shape and handle construction of this machete is great, feels really good in your hand, but does not hold up. Expected a bit more from a Gerber blade.
customer_reviews.author: PB

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. Cuts vines, small branches, shrub branches and anything else needed in a single swipe. Much more fun than pruning shears. Be aware, the handle does not have much to increase traction and will slip with wet or sweaty hands. No issues when used with gloves though. I recommend:
customer_reviews.author: Alex Janow

customer_reviews.title: He says this one is so much better it blows his other one away
customer_reviews.text: My husband uses his old machete for everything so we decided it was time to grab a new one since his was old. We tried to find the same one but couldn't so we wound up buying this one instead not really expecting much just hoping it would be close to the quality he had. He says this one is so much better it blows his other one away! The quality on this machete is great and he loves it!
customer_reviews.author: violet

customer_reviews.title: For looks, not work
customer_reviews.text: Hadn't used it really for about 4 months. Took it out to clear some brush for my children. Just small limbs and thorns...blade chipped and dented in 4 places...what the heck?? I'd expect some kind of durability from Gerber. Machete is for looks, not work.
customer_reviews.author: Skyler A.

customer_reviews.title: Cannot recommend this product enough
customer_reviews.text: Cannot recommend this product enough. With a good swing cuts through inch+ think branches. Recently used the saw which is quite effective as well (you do have to brace it with your off hand on the hilt given that the backside of the saw is the main blade, but it still cut through a 7 inch branch in about 8 minutes or so of not particularly vigorous sawing). I've also used it to break up ice on the stairs in the winter and to reach socks that fall behind the wardrobe. Extremely versatile product.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher M. Celaya

customer_reviews.title: Weak metal
customer_reviews.text: I've chipped the blade three times. Once it even more the steel. I've used it on mostly bushes and vines around the house. It sharpens back easily, but since the chips are where I usually hit stuff, it keeps getting worse. I've not been easy on it, but it's still meant to be used. The handle and sheath are great though.
customer_reviews.author: Kevlar

customer_reviews.title: Not the Gerber of old
customer_reviews.text: Good for light duty but not an everyday tool. The blade is a bit thin for hacking brush which causes you to use more muscle instead of momentum. The saw blade works alright on small things but you're not going to be cutting 2 x 4's with it. It's not a bad tool, just not an everyday one.
customer_reviews.author: G. Reon

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Great product especially it having a saw teeth on the other side of the blade. Just not the greatest steel. I dropped it straight down on cement and the tip chipped right off. The sheaths belt loop immediately ripped when I gave it a light tug before I could even use it. It's not a bad product I just dont expect it to last very long.
customer_reviews.author: AAG

customer_reviews.title: strong and very sturdy grip. Feels good in your hands and is ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made, light weight Machete. It is evenly balanced, strong and very sturdy grip. Feels good in your hands and is complete with the sheath it came with. It needs to be sharpened more then what is provided as a starting knife. It is very easy to sharpen if you use the right stone or sharpener. The belt loop connection seems fine but has not been used out in the field for a long duration of time so I cant tell you how it will hold up. It seemed to do fine around the yard and is light weight on the hip when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Matt330Music

customer_reviews.title: THIS thing is awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to clear dense brush....its as strong and sharp as I hoped it would be, with the Gerber name on it. Chopped through the thick waist high grass with very little effort. If I could give it a better rating than 5 stars, I definitely would!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Smith

customer_reviews.title: What should be get for dad for Christmas?
customer_reviews.text: So, what do you get for your dad Christmas who generally will purchase whatever he wants, when he wants it. Why not a Machete? That is exactly what I was thinking! It was a great purchase and he was excited to get it. He keeps it right behind his night stand. ( If you accidentally break into his house, please be aware of the Machete swinging .45 Magnum wielding man you may encounter. I was only responsible for half of that mess.... ) We have never really tried cutting down branches or clearing fields with it, but we have swung it around and it does feel more sturdy than other Machete's I have swung.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce

customer_reviews.title: High quality.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very functional machete. It is sharp out of the package. I will say the teeth bent just a little on a 6 inch diameter sunflower stalk. The sheath is very high quality. I would recommend and purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: L.M.mC

customer_reviews.title: Blade is bent and cracked after one use
customer_reviews.text: Like many others here, I can confirm that this is a really poor quality metal. My blade is bent and cracked after a few hours of cutting brush and twigs. I'm really kind of angry about it. I'll never get another Gerber knife for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Mental114

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy it
customer_reviews.text: I took this on one walk to make a trail through some thick bruch qith my uncle who just got a machete from walmart. The gerber was all banged up and the walmart one was still in good shape. Then i took a knee to get a drink and the sheeth broke.. this is not worth the money at all
customer_reviews.author: adam bergstrom

customer_reviews.title: nothing wrong here.
customer_reviews.text: Definately a legit product, not sure why the 1 star reviews, those people have really high expectations for this. What were they wanting, a light saber? It wont go through a tree just by whacking it, it could be slightly sharper, but not dull by any means. If you want to take a tree down, just turn it around :). Not sure if the saw blades are sharp enough to be efficient, will update later after a test is done. The handle seems good enough to me. So all in all parts probably could be sharper, but I rather choose how sharp I want it. Also a safe and secure device.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. J

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly, safe handle and sharp.
customer_reviews.text: Great macehete. Used it for clearing bushes and branches from the backyard. Comes out of the box sharp as all hell and the sheath is very safe. For the function and sleek black look, it was a very good price. A complaint I have is how the sticker was not easy to remove from the blade, and how I wish the sheath had some sort of sling. However, these are purely convenient/cosmetic complaints and this did not affect the operation of the machete whatsoever. Would definitely recommed!
customer_reviews.author: Tristan Rayner

customer_reviews.title: it a toy blade i would give to a 12 year old
customer_reviews.text: My complaints: #1 its dull as a butter knife and not heavy duty as I thought it would be like all gerber products. Secondly, the blade edge is fairly soft and I end up using the sawing edge much more than I feel is necessary. I shouldn't have to be sawing through 1" branches, the machete should swing through those easily enough. Positives: The saw is the best part of this product, it serves its overall purpose pretty well, but there are better options out there. Its a great product to keep in the camp gear.
customer_reviews.author: dack

customer_reviews.title: Complete Fail
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to cut the decorative beach grass in my yard but it was a complete fail. The knife edge failed to get through hardly anything at all in 30 minutes. Not sure what the metal is they use but there was a tremendous amount of flex I've never experienced in another blade. Heck, out of curiosity I took my wife's 15 year old introductory model Henckels kitchen knife and it worked 100X better.
customer_reviews.author: NJ Reader

customer_reviews.title: Love At First Sight
customer_reviews.text: After checking the reviews on this machete on youtube, I figure it was a great purchase. The product arrived before the estimated delivery date and packaging was beat up. I took the tol out and used the saw blade to cut a few small limbs from trees and was truly impressed. However yesterday I was in the bush resetting cameras and bait for pigs, I had to ct a few vines for unobstructed views for the cameras and when swinging the machete I could feel the blade bowing or flexing as I swing. I don't think this is a good tool for chopping a small tree but a pretty good hand saw.
customer_reviews.author: Semper Fi

customer_reviews.title: Ready for the Purge
customer_reviews.text: These things are so sweet. I love drinking the Hennessy and running around the yard swinging them over my head while shirtless. I bought 2, one for each hand. These are great for threatening trees, hacking up branches, and running down the street while wearing a clown mask. 5/5 would buy several more if I had more hands.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: broken sheath
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used the machete yet but after 1 month of storage, the nylon sheath belt loop came off. Aside from the sheath, the machete looks awesome. I didn't notice it until after the "return by" date since I'm not using the machete for a few more months, so I'm unable to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: just kinda disappointing, really
customer_reviews.text: I bought this expecting it to be sharp on both ends, but neither are. The serrated side is just kinda annoying. If you hit the sharp edge into a tree hard, it will kinda go in almost a third of the way, but it's not really much. I feel like this could've been better.
customer_reviews.author: David Gulland

customer_reviews.title: Not for heavy use...
customer_reviews.text: Initially I was surprised at the good performance... however by the end of the first day this item had several damaged areas on the blade. It was never near anything other than smaller tree branches we were collecting for kindle. I think the steel is mild, or poorly tempered? Either way it’s a very light use item. Not for serious use!
customer_reviews.author: Luke Pomerleau

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy Blade.
customer_reviews.text: This machete looks great but has a very flimsy blade that flexes quite a bit. I haven't used mine yet but I will be carefull and I do not expect it to chop through much more then grass and weeds. I doubt if anything above 2" in diameter would get cut down without damage to this blade.
customer_reviews.author: Broadwing

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price. I’ll say it again...GOOD for the PRICE. Used it outside in the yard and it’s held up so far. Edge was ok when it arrived, I’ve sharpened it up and gave it a workout the last few weeks. No, it’s not an heirloom piece and definitely not special forces caliber - but for less than twenty dollars it’s wirth it.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Not the same quality as a few years ago
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the same size Gerber machete about 10 years ago from a large outdoor retailer, and have never had any problem with it. The one I ordered a couple of months ago for my son is not the same quality. The edge is thinner and is beginning to bend and warp with use. I think it's only a matter of time before notches start showing up in it. If you're like me, you tend to discount some of the super-negative reviews you read on Amazon. I'm beginning to think that they might be spot-on about this machete. How can a company like Gerber throw away their reputation like this?
customer_reviews.author: PTR

customer_reviews.title: Not that great
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. My 12 year old son used it for one day and the tip had some pretty bad dings in it. He was using it on some thicker vegetation, but it wasn’t like he was trying to chop down trees.
customer_reviews.author: William Matthew Stegmaier

customer_reviews.title: Great for hiking and camping
customer_reviews.text: Big long sharp blade. Great for hiking and camping. It can be carried on your belt. The sheath is hard, not nylon, the blade is long, which makes the sheath longer and a bit bulky but not to bad. Serrated blade on one side, knife blade on the other is great for sawing, cutting, a must have if you spend time outside. I keep this with me all the time around water and unfamiliar areas I go. Also would be good for protection if it came to that. Good quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Duke

customer_reviews.title: the machete is good enough for 1" or less branches
customer_reviews.text: the machete is good enough for 1" or less branches... i bought 2 of them in 1 week and both gave me the same problem. after 5-10 minutes of use the sharpen side of the blade would bend inwards right in the middle of the whole blade. i had the Jr model years ago and never had a problem with that one .
customer_reviews.author: tony

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this machete
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this machete. It's my 2nd one (after my first one flew out of my hand and into a canal). I've cut a ton of invasive pepper bush with this machete and it has never failed me - even on branches over an inch thick. Do yourself a favor and get the Smith's machete sharpener for it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Basterson

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. Edge bends and rolls on first use on berry plants
customer_reviews.text: Bent and the edge roll first time I used it ( on BlackBerry bushes ) Buy something else, this one sucks. It might work if there is a zombie apocalypse...but have a knife just in case
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Barlow

customer_reviews.title: Great blade
customer_reviews.text: Item is as shown. Has a slight edge but you will need to sharpen it.sheth is decent and seems to hold together. The saw part of the blade is just metal bent in 2 directions but no actual edge on it, would still work for a saw but unsure how long it would hold out. The blade once sharpened works well for cutting brush, small branches and just about anything else that gets in my way while exploring the woods. The handle is decently comfortable, grips nicely and keeps vibrations to a minimum when in use.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Bought to bring fishing when I go to my local lake and need to get places where humans aren't supposed to go. Was able to slice and dice through the thickest branches including scotch boom and dead branches. Was really impressed with how easy it felt in my hand and the grip made it non-slip. Really happy that I was able to fish in areas that were previously closed off to me.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan G

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality - Not for heavy duty bush wacking
customer_reviews.text: As long a you cut thru the limb entirely the first cut this thing is great. But the blade dents/bends when you pull it out of the harder wood that you may not cut all the way through (water oak and scrub oak are a no go). So if you keep it to cutting soft limbs (pine and sweet gun, and maple) under 3/4" it will be fine. I sent one back and they sent me another one due to this, now I just keep this one on the 4 wheeler to get the small limbs that might be hanging over the path as I ride along.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Faucette

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere these are cheap garbage!
customer_reviews.text: Complete garbage and a waste of money. The idea seemed great with a saw and a blade but the first time out with it, the handle. Broke right off! Turns out it's not full tang and the handle material is cheap. Not expecting this from gerber at all. I figured I had other gerber knives and this would be good. Not the case at all,left me with a broken tool in the middle of the woods. There are other ones out there look at them and skip this one, oh. And it's amazing to me that they recalled these knives because of the handle and the updated one is just as bad.
customer_reviews.author: James s

customer_reviews.title: The blade dented upon first use.
customer_reviews.text: After using to chop and prune an apple tree, I found out several dents were created on the blade as a result. Very cheap material. Aesthetically pleasing but not durable at all.
customer_reviews.author: DKuti

customer_reviews.title: I didn't expect the finest blade, but in using it to cut small ...
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect the finest blade, but in using it to cut small branches and brush to clear a path through my woods, it almost instantly (within the first 5 minutes of use) bent and chunks of it broke off!! It's still intact, but I wouldn't use it for anything other than decoration.
customer_reviews.author: Elias Espinal

customer_reviews.title: OK machete, but could be tougher
customer_reviews.text: Good for light work. This is NOT a full tang machete. A such, the blade can break free of the grip when chopping tougher materials. I ended up returning the one I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: t.dreyer

customer_reviews.title: Sharp, light and sturdy - Great tool for trails and backyard messes
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these a while back and was using it to clean up fallen limbs and trees after one of the Pacific Northwest's famous wind storms. My brother-in-law admired how easily it sliced 2" branches off a fallen tree, and its a lot lighter than a hatchet or axe. So I bought one for him this Christmas. I've used mine many times in the backyard, and up in the hills to collect wood for the campfire. It's easy to keep sharpened with a file, and all I have do to keep it rust free is wipe it off now and then with a rag or paper towel (or pant leg).
customer_reviews.author: K. Bush

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be sharper
customer_reviews.text: Great weight and size, but not very sharp....got it to cut down some large grass and brambles and just ended up beating them over instead of cutting them.
customer_reviews.author: Kielha

customer_reviews.title: bad sheath of no value.
customer_reviews.text: great blade, but don't count on the sheath to hold up. Broke the belt loop 10 minutes into a hike to clear trails.
customer_reviews.author: Gwen

customer_reviews.title: My grandson loves it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson to have in the kayak i gave him for using on the Miakkak river.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Being Gerber and all, I thought it would be at least decent enough to last a year. I used this to cut down ONE big bush (about 10 feet in diameter) and the blade actually broke! I mean the edge of the blade sliced off, not that the blade came ofd the handle. Piece if junk, remove it from amazon. I bought a cheaper Tramontina high carbon steel machete and it is fantastic! Buy tramontina, not this junk.
customer_reviews.author: Hector M.

customer_reviews.title: Not a Samurai Sword
customer_reviews.text: Heavy and not very sharp. Will not cut sawgrass or thick vines on first whack. Not practical for yard maintenance. Has a safety strap, which will keep it from backfiring.
customer_reviews.author: Albarelli

customer_reviews.title: Looks awesome, feels good in your hand,balanced nicely and seems to be high quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great machete looks awesome feels great in your hand and nice balance, can't wait to put it to the test. I'll update once I do and change if anything changes but seems to be good quality and a great buy I paid $15.00 well worth $35 and up.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp machete
customer_reviews.text: This is a good machete, it cuts down banana trees great and are very sharp. Only odd thing was it looked dirty in the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Machete of Machetes.
customer_reviews.text: Very strong steel design. Very comfortable handle and easy to sharpen. Used to saw branches and cut shrubs. Very essential tool.
customer_reviews.author: Antwan Ellis

customer_reviews.title: went from good quality to monkey metal
customer_reviews.text: The original gator I purchased way back when they first came out was a 5 star plus. I would still be using it if my son hadn't decided to leave it on my back bumper. the steel was strong. the one I have now is made of monkey metal. it is very poor quality and I will not purchase another.
customer_reviews.author: mmorris

customer_reviews.title: Just keep scrolling...
customer_reviews.text: You pay for what you get. I bought this to use at a agro-forestry workshop because it looked super awesome and also had a saw on the back of it!! Anyways, the blade is cheap, flexible, and the edge totally flopped on me after hitting a soft ass Chaya tree. I disliked it so much that I bought a "Tramotina" while I was there and hid this Gerber thing behind the door in a shed.
customer_reviews.author: Kim gibbons

customer_reviews.title: Bow Hunter
customer_reviews.text: I use this from time to time for landscaping but typically I use it for hanging "sets," treestand locations and cutting shooting lanes for bow hunting. This is a must have tool for a hunter. The blade is balanced very well and delivers a tremendous blow to the object you are striking. I have ripped through over 3 inch saplings with a single strike. Probably the most underrated aspect of this tool is the saw blade. Again, this attribute is devastating. It has pretty much removed the temptation that I will ever need a chainsaw for this purpose. I am still on my original after two seasons and have purchased two others as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy L. Mcconnaughey

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: We initially bought the mini version of this for a christmas gift and it was great quality so when I saw this on amazon I had to buy it for a birthday gift which was greatly appreciated and loved. Now both my son and hubbie has the mini and the regular size of this ... they both bring it when they go 4-wheeling so they can cut branches out of there way. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Britty

customer_reviews.title: Broken blade cutting underbrush
customer_reviews.text: Though the blade looks very durable upon opening, the actual strength of the steel was incredibly weak. After less than 30 minutes of cutting small brush around the house, the edge of the blade was nearly useless. Denting, and even breaking at a spot, this purchase left me feeling extremely disappointed. I am still searching for a machete to take along on an upcoming TELEVISED survival challenge. Sadly, this WILL NOT be coming along with me.
customer_reviews.author: reviews

customer_reviews.title: Comes dull, and the belt loop on the sheath is weak
customer_reviews.text: It’s comfortable in hand, and feels good to swing, but, I’m pretty sure it’s not a full tang, comes shipped very dull, and the very first time I attached it to my belt, I took about 50 steps and the belt loop broke. The loop is very cheap, thin, and only stitched on with a single stitch row... I’m going to put a nice edge on it, and rivet a better strap on the sheath, and see what happens
customer_reviews.author: luke vanderjagt

customer_reviews.title: This one is the best one I've owned.
customer_reviews.text: I use this machete daily with my job, so it was important to have a good one. I am very satisfied with the quality of this particular one. In fact, it's probably the best one I've owned so far. VERY IMPORTANT not to judge it by the first use, as the thin part of the blade gets easily damaged the first time, after sharpening it down to the thicker part of the blade, then it's awesome! The grip is my favorite thing about it.
customer_reviews.author: rob kulp

customer_reviews.title: its ok, wouldnt buy again
customer_reviews.text: Its ok. Gave it a few whacks and the handle became a little loose. Not a very useful tool and it is not built all that great. If youre looking for something when you go camping, an axe or hatchet will do the trick better than this. the blade is too flimsy as well. It is just ok, not a great machete. Not that sharp either when it comes out of the box and after a few whacks the tip of the blade got chipped as well.
customer_reviews.author: Omid

customer_reviews.title: Nice design. Fair function.
customer_reviews.text: Not too much negative to say about this product. It has a nice weight to it, strong handle. I did find that the blade is a bit thin. Needed to clear some brush and had to strike a few times on thicker branches. You may want a blade sharpener as the blade dulls quickly.
customer_reviews.author: L. Torres

product_meta.title: Gerber Gator Machete - Black w/ Nylon Sheath [31-000758]
product_meta.description:
Gerber Gator machete - Black W/ nylon sheath [31-000758]

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Gator Machete wields a 15-inch fine edge blade on one side, a 18-inch high performance saw blade on the other, and our proprietary Gator rubber grip for ergonomic control while using either. The riveted, nylon sheath provides safe, durable transport. Clear foliage with a single swipe. Machete also doubles as a saw. Great for clearing shooting lanes. Quality, tough, black oxide-coated steel blade is 15", fine razor's edge with "toothy" serrated saw on top. Gator sure-grip handle 25" overall, weighs 1 pound, lanyard hole. Black 400-denier heavy nylon sheath with belt loop.
feature_bullets: Blade Steel: High Carbon steel. Riveted, nylon sheath included
18 inch blade features a full performance saw on one side, a 15 inch fine edge blade on the other
Handle Material: Gator Grip overmold, Sheath Material: Nylon
Gator grip rubberized handle for comfort and control

specifications.Included Components: Gerber Gator Machete - Black w/ Nylon Sheath [31-000758]
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars2,446 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
